intro: Phalaenopsis grandiflora var. borneensis, commonly known as the Bornean moth orchid, is a tropical orchid native to the island of Borneo. It is characterized by its long, pendant inflorescences bearing numerous white to pale pink flowers that resemble moths, hence its common name. The plant has broad,革质 (leathery) leaves that are arranged in a rosette pattern, and it thrives in warm, humid environments with indirect light. It is a popular choice for indoor cultivation due to its elegant appearance and relatively low maintenance requirements. This variety is also valued for its ability to produce multiple blooms over an extended period.
